trial_identification.studytitle: The effect of zopiclone on the respiratory arousal threshold in obstructive sleep apnoea
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The effect of zopiclone on the respiratory arousal threshold in obstructive sleep apnoea

interventions.interventions:
Zopiclone (7.5mg), once only immediately before going to bed, taken orally.
1 week washout
interventions.comparator: Placebo (sugar pill), taken orally (participants will act as their own controls in a cross-over design)

primaryOutcome.outcome: Respiratory arousal threshold (negative pharyngeal pressure immediately prior to arousal from sleep using an epiglottic pressure catheter inserted via the nostril)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Acute overnight studies on zopiclone vs. placebo

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Genioglossus muscle activity during sleep measured using fine-wire intramuscular electromyography
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Acute overnight studies on zopiclone vs. placebo

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Polysomnographic measures of sleep apnoea severity (e.g. AHI, sleep efficiency, arousal index, event duration, and nadir SaO2)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Acute overnight studies on zopiclone vs. placebo

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Men and women with obtructive sleep apnoea
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: -Known allergy or previous adverse reaction to zopiclone -Pregnant or nursing mothers -Patients with any other medical condition which may interfere in the evaluation of the study - Patients taking medications known to affect sleep or muscle activity

trial_design.statisticalmethods: It is estimated that studying 12 participants will allow us to detect a 4cmH2O difference (SD=4.5) in the respiratory arousal threshold between placebo and zopiclone conditions (paired t-test) with >80% power. This calculation is based on a similar effect size for other common sedatives and a between night difference in the SD of the respiratory arousal threshold using similar methodology (e.g. Eckert el al, Clin Sci, 2011 and Eckert et al, Sleep 2014).

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The purpose of this physiology study is to determine the effects of zopiclone (sedative) on the awakening (arousal) response to respiratory stimuli during sleep and on upper airway muscle activity and breathing during sleep.
